column1: Every one ran to the queen's room. But the queen could give no orders. They soon found out
column4: and in a moment the palace was like a beehive in a garden; and in one minute more the queen was brought to herself by a great shout and a clapping of hands. They had found the princess fast asleep under a rose-bush
column5: to which the elfish little wind-puff had carried her
column6: finishing its mischief by shaking a shower of red rose-leaves all over the little white sleeper. Startled by the noise the servants made
column10: scattered the rose-leaves in all directions
column11: like a shower of spray in the sunset.She was watched more carefully after this
column12: no doubt; yet it would be endless to relate all the odd incidents resulting from this peculiarity of the young princess. But there never was a baby in a house
column14: that kept the household in such constant good humour
